page.title: 16THE MOUSE TRAP
page.content: The{mouse trap}belongs to{Mr and Mrs {Cooke of Coppice Farm.}It has been in their family for many years and is still in working condition. The mouse trap consists of five small compartments, each big enough for some cheese or bacon rind and a mouse to fit in.It is made of wood and metal. The trap is a musty brown colour.The metal is covered in dried blood,and is a reddish colour.Fixed on top of each compartment is a small piece of twisted wire tied in a{noose}in a{ {slip knot. When the mouse is tempted by the cheese he puts his head through the noose and walks towards the cheese,and chokes to death. The most mice the Cookes have caught in one night is four.
